def_cn: （表示比较而言唯一真实、恰当或必要的情况）只，只有
def_en: You use only to indicate the one thing that is true, appropriate, or necessary in a particular situation, in contrast to all the other things that are not true, appropriate, or necessary.

def_cn: （引出发生的必要条件）只有…（才）
def_en: You use only to introduce the thing which must happen before the thing mentioned in the main part of the sentence can happen.

def_cn: 唯一的；仅有的
def_en: If you talk about the only person or thing involved in a particular situation, you mean there are no others involved in it.

def_cn: （孩子）独生的,仅有的
def_en: An only child is a child who has no brothers or sisters.

def_cn: (尤用于想要纠正错误观点时)只不过，仅…而已
def_en: You use only to indicate that something is no more important, interesting, or difficult, for example, than you say it is, especially when you want to correct a wrong idea that someone may get or has already got.

def_cn: （强调数量少或时间短）才，仅仅
def_en: You use only to emphasize how small an amount is or how short a length of time is.

def_cn: （强调是其中的一小部分，而非全部）只，仅仅
def_en: You use only to emphasize that you are talking about a small part of an amount or group, not the whole of it.

def_cn: （用于 can 或 could 之后，强调除此以外别无可为）只（能）
def_en: Only is used after 'can' or 'could' to emphasize that it is impossible to do anything except the rather inadequate or limited action that is mentioned.

def_cn: （强调希望或愿望）唯有，非常
def_en: You can use only in the expressions I only wish or I only hope in order to emphasize what you are hoping or wishing.

def_cn: （用于表示稍加改动或限定）只是，不过
def_en: Only can be used to add a comment which slightly changes or limits what you have just said.

def_cn: （用于含有 would 的从句后，引出未做某事的原因）要不是，若非
def_en: Only can be used after a clause with 'would' to indicate why something is not done.

def_cn: （用于不定式前）不料，结果却
def_en: You can use only before an infinitive to introduce an event which happens immediately after one you have just mentioned, and which is rather surprising or unfortunate.

def_cn: （强调行动或行为恰当）完全，真正
def_en: You can use only to emphasize how appropriate a certain course of action or type of behaviour is.

def_cn: （用于动词前，表示结果令人遗憾或不受欢迎）愈加，只（会）
def_en: You can use only in front of a verb to indicate that the result of something is unfortunate or undesirable and is likely to make the situation worse rather than better.

def_cn: 只要（做…）即可
def_en: If you say you only have to or have only to do one thing in order to achieve or prove a second thing, you are emphasizing how easily the second thing can be achieved or proved.

def_cn: 刚才；刚刚
def_en: You can say that something has only just happened when you want to emphasize that it happened a very short time ago.

def_cn: 仅仅；勉强
def_en: You use only just to emphasize that something is true, but by such a small degree that it is almost not true at all.

def_cn: 太；极
def_en: You can use only too to emphasize that something is true or exists to a much greater extent than you would expect or like.

def_cn: （强调乐意）极，非常
def_en: You can say that you are only too happy to do something to emphasize how willing you are to do it.
if only→see: if;  not only→see: not;  the one and only→see: one;
